Reasons
A ùëõ(ùêøùëÜ)+ùëõ(ùêµùëÜ)n(LS)+n(BS) does not count all the students.
B ùëõ(ùêøùëÜ)+ùëõ(ùêµùëÜ)n(LS)+n(BS) counts some students more than once.

Their teacher asks each student to tick off the toppings they want on a list. Then the teacher asks them to organise the choices so he can order the most popular combinations of toppings. The students have been studying Venn diagrams. And now they see an opportunity to turn the tables on their teacher. Here is the information they give to him:

  • 99 students want all three toppings.
  • 88 students want bacon and ham but not mushrooms.
  • 1919 students want mushrooms and bacon.
  • 1313 students want mushrooms and ham.
  • 3030 students want mushrooms.

  1. The teacher also knows how to turn the tables. So he gives the information to you and says "Please tell me how many of the students want mushrooms only." What is the answer?

    Answer:

    There are students who want mushrooms only.

    Answer:
